channel.title: Langflow Blog
channel.description: Explore the latest news, updates, and insights from the Langflow team. Learn about the latest features, best practices, and how to get the most out of Langflow.

item.title: Build an alt text generator with Langflow and Next.js
item.description: Tired of the tedious task of writing alt text? This article will show you how to build AltTextr, an AI-powered app using Langflow, Next.js, and OpenAI that you collaborate with to generate high-quality alternative text, helping you create better, more accessible websites.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Phil Nash,Unknown)

item.title: Build Your Own GPT-5: Smart Model Routing with Langflow
item.description: Between o3, o1, 4o, GPT-5, Claude-4.1-opus, Gemini, etc. choosing the right model name for our applications can feel like picking a health insurance plan. In this post, we fix this with Langflow by building a powerful Multi-Agent System (MAS) that implements the LLM-as-judge pattern: one agent decides "think" or "default," an if-else routes the query, and specialized agents do the work.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: How to Build a Deep-Research Multiâ€‘Agent System
item.description: This blog post dives into Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) and explains how to build a basic deep research workflow in Langflow and explains when to prefer them over single-agent systems. We also explore how Langflow particularly shines here, enabling rapid iteration and cherry picking the best models per specialized agentic task.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: 100k stars on GitHub â­ï¸
item.description:
Langflow just hit 100k stars on GitHub!
Langflow began as a small experiment and has grown into something far bigger than we ever imagined â€” thanks to the thousands whoâ€™ve written code, fixed bugs, shared feedback, and trusted it for their projects.
Hitting 100k stars is a proud milestone, but our mission to democratize AI goes on â€” and we still treat every day like itâ€™s day one.
Thank you for being part of this journey.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Rodrigo Nader,Unknown)

item.title: The Troubleshooter: Using Render's MCP service to Make Life Easier
item.description: I recently came across Render's new MCP service, and as an avid user of Render to deploy various Python and Javascript based applications, it seemed like a good time to check out how I could use it in my day to day operations. This blog post dives into my experience using this new service with Cursor, Warp, and Langflow and how I was able to use to improve my service with agents.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (David Jones-Gilardi,Unknown)

item.title: How to run OpenAIâ€™s gpt-oss and GPT-5 models on Langflow
item.description: Learn how to enable access to the newest OpenAI models, GPT-5 and the open-source gpt-oss-20b and gpt-oss-120b, within Langflow. From running locally, to cloud services, and employing the models as agents, check out how to start using the latest models in Langflow.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Phil Nash,Unknown)

item.title: Query, Split, Search, Synthesize: Automating Deep Research with JigsawStack and Langflow
item.description: While platforms like Perplexity and OpenAI offer deep research through closed systems, developers can now build their own transparent, extensible research agents using JigsawStack's open-source framework within Langflow. This hands-on guide shows how to create a multi-step research pipeline that breaks down complex queries, performs iterative web searches, and compiles evidence-backed reportsâ€”all through visual workflows that accelerate development without writing code. Learn to prototype AI research agents that you can see, modify, and scale for your specific needs.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Harsha Vardhan Khurdula,Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: Langflow 1.5: Docling, Windows Support and Improved UX
item.description: Langflow 1.5 brings a simplified, stable foundation for building AI workflows. With clean core components, improved execution, and a smoother UI, Langflow keeps evolving for real-world use. Langflow Desktop is now available for Windows, and the new Docling Bundle takes document processing to a new level.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Rodrigo Nader,Unknown)

item.title: How to Create Secure AI Applications
item.description:

item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: LLM Observability Explained (feat. Langfuse, LangSmith, and LangWatch)
item.description: Building a new application powered by Large Language Models (LLMs) is an exciting venture. With frameworks and APIs at our fingertips, creating a proof-of-concept can tak
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: From 'no-reply' to 'please-reply': How to build an AI-Powered Email Assistant with Langflow and SendGrid
item.description: This post will walk you through how you can build your own "please-reply" system using Langflow, the easiest way to build AI agents, and SendGrid's Inbound Parse. We'll show you how you can build one for your own organization.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.title: Build AI powered phone calls with Twilio ConversationRelay and Langflow
item.description: Connect your Langflow flows to phone calls using Twilio ConversationRelay and build AI-powered voice assistants. Learn to handle speech-to-text and text-to-speech, and how to stream responses for a more natural conversation.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Phil Nash,Unknown)

item.title: Generate Personalized Action Figures and Mythical Creatures using next.js and AI with Langflow
item.description: Hello, fellow dev nerds! ðŸ‘‹ Inspired by some intriguing displays at GitHub Universe, we embarked on a mission to create an app that generates unique, visually stunning "C
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (David Jones-Gilardi,Unknown)

item.title: Building an AI-powered Fashion Recommendation App
item.description: In this guide, Melissa Herrera walks through the development process of creating an AI fashion recommendation app that takes user-provided images and/or text queries to deliver tailored clothing recommendations.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: How to Host Your AI Agents and MCP Servers on Langflow Anywhere
item.description: This guide will walk you through deploying Langflow to a variety of popular hosting platforms - FlightControl, Fly.io, Render, and Hetzner - transforming your local projects into globally accessible AI powerhouses.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Tejas Kumar,Unknown)

item.description:

item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Scott Regan,Unknown)

item.title: ðŸŒ Web Search in Your AI Agents: A Langflow Tutorial
item.description: LLM models face a significant limitation: they're often restricted to information available in their training data. But what if your AI agent could retrieve up-to-date information from the web in real time? Let's walk you through how to implement web search capabilities in your Langflow flows.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (Melissa Herrera,Unknown)

item.title: Launch Week Day 1 - MCP âš¡ï¸
item.description: Langflow can now be used as both an MCP client and MCP server. As a client, you can use a built-in MCP component to interact with external MCP servers within your agentic flows. As a server, you can turn your existing Langflow workflows into tools that other MCP clients can access and orchestrate.
item.author: please-reply@langflow.org (David Jones-Gilardi,Unknown)
